sections.sectionSummary: This simple walkthrough will explain the research study, the impact it may have on your life and will allow you to provide your consent to participate.
This study will ask you to perform tasks and respond to surveys.
This study will also gather sensor and health data from your iPhone and personal devices with your permission.
Collected data may allow researchers, as well as you, to understand patterns and details about heart health.
Your data will be encrypted and sent to a secure database, with your name replaced by a random code.
Your coded study data will be used for research by Stanford and may be shared with other researchers approved by Stanford.
Your initial participation in this study will take 10-15 minutes per day for a week. We hope that you can contribute to the study for one week every three months.
Some of the tasks in this study will require you to answer survey questions about health and lifestyle factors.
We will ask you to complete active tasks that may require physical activity.
You may withdraw your consent and discontinue participation at any time.
The information collected by this study may help you better understand and monitor your heart health.
Some questions may make you uncomfortable.  Simply do not respond.
Participating in this study may change how you feel. You may feel more tired, sad, energized, or happy.
We will make every effort to protect your information, but total anonymity cannot be guaranteed.
